CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: To further study the performance of the PSC devices , the hole mobilities in the photosensitive layers were measured by the space charge limited current ( SCLC ) method using devices with structure of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / Au at the optimized blend ratio of polymer / PC71BM.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. ITO (Indium Tin Oxide)
2. PEDOT (Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene))
3. PSS (Polystyrene Sulfonate)
4. PC71BM (Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene):Polystyrene Sulfonate)
5. Au (Gold)

Let me know if you have any questions or if you'd like me to identify any other entities in the paragraph!
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the Material Name entities in the paragraph after removing the irrelevant entities:

1. PC71BM (Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene):Polystyrene Sulfonate)

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid Material Name entities in the paragraph as a Markdown table:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| ITO |
| PEDOT |
| PSS |
| PC71BM |
| Au |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: To further study the performance of the PSC devices , the hole mobilities in the photosensitive layers were measured by the space charge limited current ( SCLC ) method using devices with structure of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / Au at the optimized blend ratio of polymer / PC71BM.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the "Property Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. "PSC devices" - This refers to the photovoltaic devices being studied.
2. "holes mobilities" - This refers to the mobility of holes in the photosensitive layers of the devices.
3. "space charge limited current (SCLC)" - This is a method used to measure the holes mobilities.
4. "ITO" - This refers to the indium tin oxide (In2SnO5) layer in the device structure.
5. "PEDOT" - This refers to the poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene) layer in the device structure.
6. "PSS" - This refers to the poly(styrene sulfonate) layer in the device structure.
7. "polymer" - This refers to the polymer layer in the device structure.
8. "PC71BM" - This refers to the poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene):polystyrene sulfonate) layer in the device structure.
9. "Au" - This refers to the gold layer in the device structure.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

Of course! Here are the relevant entities in the paragraph that refer to material properties:

1. "holes mobilities" - This refers to the mobility of holes in the photosensitive layers of the devices, which is a material property.
2. "ITO" - This refers to the indium tin oxide (In2SnO5) layer in the device structure, which is a material property.
3. "PEDOT" - This refers to the poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene) layer in the device structure, which is a material property.
4. "PSS" - This refers to the poly(styrene sulfonate) layer in the device structure, which is a material property.
5. "polymer" - This refers to the polymer layer in the device structure, which is a material property.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any questions.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to material properties, presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Property Name":

| --- |

| PEDOT |
| PSS |
